page.title: 03Vale View Farm
page.content: There are 93 ewes with their 188 lambs.Mark has just built a sheep pen in the field ready to hold the sheep for shearing.The wool is taken from the sheep once a year, usually in May or June. The lambs will be sent to the market next Autumn. Mrs. Hyslop looks after the cade lambs. These lambs are from ewes which have had 3 lambs and can only look after 2 of them. The cade lambs are fed by bottle. Mark is mowing the grass this June ready to make into silage. The grass is allowed to dry in the sun. It is then chopped into small pieces and blown into trailers.It is then put into a heap or clamp and sealed down. This will provide next winter's feed for the cattle and sheep. The farm also grows 25 acres of wheat. The corn is sold and the straw is used for animal bedding in the winter.
